articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 169
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 169
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean Peopleâ€™s Army and supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, state and army, inspected KPA Unit 169 honored with the title of the O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment.
					 He was greeted by the commander of the large combined unit and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					 After receiving a salute, he waved back to the service personnel enthusiastically cheering in tears of emotion. He had a photo session with them.
					
					 Conducted by commanding officers, he went round the monument to the revolutionary history and the spring site associated with unforgettable stories. Visiting the unit in May 1998, General Secretary Kim Jong Il was pleased that the command of the unit was successfully built in the good place chosen by President Kim Il Sung while visiting it five times and its building looked like a rest home. 
					
					 Going round the room dedicated to the education of the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the unit, he recollected with deep emotion the undying leadership feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il associated with the proud course covered by the unit shining with heroic feats.
					
					 He called upon the unit to conduct the combat and political training well, not forgetting the loving care Kim Jong Il showed for its service personnel by having a picture taken with them as he had promised them four years ago while inspecting their unit in November last year, the last period of his life. He, at the same time, urged them to live up to the deep trust Kim Jong Il reposed in them by encouraging them to stand at the head of the whole army, calling the unit the unit like a tiger of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un acquainted himself with the training of the unit.
					
					 Noting that the unit has a very important duty to perform, he set forth the important tasks which would serve as guidelines for increasing the combat capability of the unit in every way.
					
					 The primary duty of the soldiers is to conduct training well, he said, underlining the need to concentrate all efforts on intensifying training and prepare the service personnel of the unit as all-round fighters capable of satisfactorily and independently discharging any combat duty, in particular.
					
					 Making the round of the soldiers' hall and library, he expressed satisfaction over the fact that the unit has conducted political and ideological education of the soldiers in a unique manner to suit their characteristic features by keeping diverse materials for ideological and cultural education and building sufficient facilities for that purpose. 
					
					 He stressed the need to continue paying primary attention to the political and ideological education of soldiers so that they may become fighters strong in idea and faith.
					
					 Looking at the photos of combat heroes, he said that the unit would produce more heroes in the future. He called on it to improve the education by use of materials on combat feats to train all its service personnel as heroes.
					
					 Stopping before the photos of the officers whom soldiers call "our officers," he appreciated the officers who have warmly loved their soldiers, regarding them as revolutionary comrades-in-arms.
					
					 Then he dropped in at a mess hall and looked at the program for observing the "day for soldiers." He was pleased to learn that commanding officers and families of service personnel have made every sincere effort to take good care of soldiers.
					
					 Going round a bedroom, an education room and training and lecture rooms of a company under the unit, he took care of the soldiers' living as their real father would do.
					
					 He invited the commanding officers of the unit which Kim Jong Il visited in the last period of his life to have a picture taken together.
					
					 Calling upon them to take warm care of the living of the soldiers, he said only by doing so, they will make success in training and it is possible to bolster the combat capability of the unit. He earnestly told the officers to make long and difficult marches for training all together this year and thus finish the combat preparations of the unit without fail as desired by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong and Pak Jae Gyong and KPA Lieut. Gen. Ri Tu Song.

articles.title: Birthday Spread to Pro-Reunification Champion
articles.content:
Birthday Spread to Pro-Reunification Champion
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The dear respected             Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Ham Se Hwan, a pro-reunification champion, on his 80th birthday.
					 Ham was born into a poor peasant family in Ongjin County, South Hwanghae Province, on Jan. 18, 1932.
					
					 After the liberation of Korea he energetically waged underground and guerrilla struggles against the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea and the unpopular moves of their puppet clique.
					
					 He was arrested just before the victory of the Fatherland Liberation War. He continued the struggle not yielding to the brutal tortures, appeasement and deception of the fascist hangmen for 34 years behind bars.
					
					 Since his release from prison he devoted all his energies to the reunification movement along with south Korean progressive organisations.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il put him forward as a Hero of the DPRK and winner of the National Reunification Prize and showed loving care for Ham so that the older he got, the more vigorous he became.

articles.title: Law on Higher Education Adopted in DPRK
articles.content:
Law on Higher Education Adopted in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Law on higher education was adopted in the DPRK by a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly on December 14, Juche 100 (2011).
					 The law consists of seven chapters and 68 articles.
					
					 The adoption of the law will help develop higher education with a strict system and order in the management, teaching and scientific researches of higher educational institutions. It is also conducive to bringing up many able scientists, technicians and experts with a high degree of political and ideological quality and a high level of scientific and technological knowledge and creative ability.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 100 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively deals with his works in a chronological order.
					 All 100 volumes of the complete collection have thus been published.
					
					 The last volume contains Vol. 6 of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century."
					
					 It comprehensively deals with the exploits the President performed by strengthening the Korean People's Revolutionary Army as the revolutionary forces of Juche and consolidating the unity and cohesion of the revolutionary ranks and the mass basis of the armed struggle and with the experience gained in the struggle and his personality as a great man in the period from March 1937 to November.
					
					 The book contains "Chapter 16 Crossing and Recrossing the River Amnok" telling the story that the President made an expedition to Fusong for advancing into the homeland and expanded and strengthened organizations of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland in different parts of the homeland.
					
					 The book also relates a story about the high spirit displayed by the guards of the command in defending the leader unto death and the struggle waged by anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters to perform the revolutionary duties given by the commander without fail.
					
					 Its "Chapter 17 Korea Is Alive" deals with the President's recollection of the fact that he, leading the main force of the KPRA, marched into the homeland and victoriously waged the Battle of Pochonbo. The book relates the story that the President formed a juvenile company and led its members with fatherly loving care.
					
					 Its "Chapter 18 in the Flames of the Sino-Japanese War" recounts a story that he energetically led the struggle for all-people resistance preparation to cope with the new situation.

articles.title: Commemorative Book Released
articles.content:
Commemorative Book Released
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Book "All Kinds of Flowers Came into Bloom under the Care of the Sun" was released with due ceremony in Rason City on Tuesday to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The book was authored by Ryang Ok Sun, manager of the Yanbian Overseas Chinese Trade Company in Yanji City, Jilin Province, China and director of the Rason Paekhwa Company.
					
					 In the book Ryang told about the personality of the great persons of Mt. Paektu, giving exposition of such matters as to what view of life one should take to understand one's nation and to be recognized by it on the basis of her experienced facts.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il took a benevolent step to release this book though he was so busy in the last period of his life.
					
					 At the book-releasing ceremony, the author said she keenly felt and experienced the greatness of the peerlessly great persons and indomitable mental power of Kim Jong Il's Korea while staying in the homeland.
					
					 She noted the dear respected Kim Jong Un, in bitterer grief than anybody, saw to it that the book-releasing ceremony was held with splendor.
					
					 The participants in the ceremony looked round the displayed book.

articles.title: S. Koreans and Overseas Compatriots' Profound Mourning over Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
S. Koreans and Overseas Compatriots' Profound Mourning over Demise of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The Institute for National Reunification on Monday issued a press release to inform the public at home and abroad of exceptionally profound sorrow expressed by south Koreans and overseas compatriots over the great loss to the nation.
					 According to it, the sad news came like a bolt from the blue at 12:00, December 19 last year, greatly shocking south Korea and the rest of the world.
					
					 It was reported by Internet, TVs and all other media of south Korea.
					
					 Art performances and meetings slated to take place on Christmas and the New Year were cancelled.
					
					 One hour after a special report of the DPRK was aired at least 120,000 condolatory articles were posted on five Internet websites. They had such titles as "Grief is so deep that even the sky seems to fall down. It is heart-rending to hear the news," "It is painful. We would like to share this sorrow with the brethren in the north," "We pray for the repose of the soul of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il," "Noble soul of the NDC chairman, the sun of the nation, will always be enshrined in the hearts of the people," and "General Kim Jong Il to go down in human history for all ages." 
					
					 The homeland was deluged with phone calls and messages from compatriots overseas saying they were so shocked by the sad news of the loss of the father of the nation that they could hardly believe it.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, compatriots in south Korea and overseas expressed their sad feelings, looking back with deep emotion on the noble life of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and his personality as a great man and his immortal exploits. 
					
					 Media carried special write-ups introducing the leader's brief history illustrated with his smiling portrait and pictures on his revolutionary career.
					
					 The south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo and other progressive media said that though NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il, the hero of the era and the large star, passed away his spirit and feats will last forever with history.
					
					 Highlighting the fact that he passed away on a train while making a forced march for field guidance with super-human energy until the last day of his life, media said it was "journey for settling wide-ranging issues", "storm of field guidance" and "the spirit of dying while at work" something rare to be found in any leader of the world.
					
					 People from all walks of life in south Korea said: He provided the inter-Korean summits and made sure that the inter-Korean declarations were adopted and published in order to present reunification to the Korean nation. This was a historic deed to go down in the nation's history. How good it would have been if the NDC chairman had lived longer to bring the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration into a brilliant reality.
					
					 Those who had an opportunity to meet the peerlessly great man felt more sorrowful than any others and remembered him with deep emotion.
					
					 South Korean media quoted leaders and personages of different countries as saying: Kim Jong Il was a great strategist without an equal in the world, a man possessed of bold and unpredictable strategy and policies, man of logic, a rare energetic man, a man of varied accomplishments, a man versatile in knowledge about wide-ranging issues and charismatic leader for his dynamism, humor and marvelous skill.
					
					 Overseas Koreans posted on Internet websites or contributed to publications condolatory articles under such titles as "Chairman Kim Jong Il and destiny of the country", "Compatriots wailing though night far advanced" and "Increasing number of overseas compatriots pay condolatory visits to the homeland", with their boundless yearning and grief over the demise of the father of the nation.
					
					 Their feelings were clearly manifested during the mourning and in the expression of condolences.
					
					 No sooner had the special report been made public than south Korean opposition parties including the Democratic United Party and the United Progressive Party held press conferences and issued statements and commentaries all at once to express condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Messages of condolences were sent to the north by the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Federation of Trade Unions and other organizations grouping people of all social standings.
					
					 Thousands of messages were sent to the north officially or unofficially by political parties, reunification movement organizations, civic and public organizations, religious organizations and personages of all circles in south Korea during the mourning to express condolences over his demise. The number of the similar messages the puppet Ministry of Unification claimed received reached 77.
					
					 People from all walks of life in south Korea vied with each other to form mourners groups before heading for Pyongyang.
					
					 Ri Hui Ho, widow of former south Korean President Kim Dae Jung, and Hyon Jong Un, chairperson of the Hyundai Group, and their parties made long trips via the Military Demarcation Line and expressed condolences before the bier of Kim Jong Il. Hwang Hye Ro, co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy, too, visited Pyongyang at the risk of her life to pay tribute in humble reverence to the bier of the father of the nation. 
					
					 Civic and public organizations formed mourners' groups and submitted to the puppet Ministry of Unification applications for visits to the north. Bereaved families of former President Roh Moo Hyun and Rev. Mun Ik Hwan requested the authorities to allow their condolatory visits to Pyongyang. 
					
					 Opposition parties urged the authorities to allow the dispatch of mourners' groups to Pyongyang, holding that the "National Assembly" would dispatch its mourners' group if the "government" was not ready to send a similar group. They demanded that the authorities allow the dispatch of at least a nongovernmental mourners' group on behalf of the Pan-national Council for Reconciliation and Cooperation if they were not in a position to allow NA's group of mourners. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, however, brutally suppressed those who wished to pay condolatory visits or express condolences, turning down their applications.
					
					  South Korean people of different circles set up incense-burning altars in different places and put up a fierce struggle to express condolences. In protest against the authorities' crackdown they posted "cyber incense-burning altars" on the internet websites.
					
					 Overseas compatriot mourners' delegations and groups and individual compatriots visited the DPRK to express deep condolences before the bier of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Overseas compatriot organizations formed mourning committees. During the mourning period they paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies, made public condolatory messages and statements and held memorial services, etc.
					
					 At least 500 condolatory letters and messages came to the homeland from overseas compatriot organizations and compatriots in various countries including China, the United States and Russia.
					
					 The mourning centers at the DPRK embassies and those set up by overseas compatriot organizations were crowded with an endless stream of overseas Korean mourners.
					
					 The sad feelings expressed by south Koreans of different circles and oversea compatriots were, indeed, the sincerest and the most heartfelt and irrepressible.
					
					 The press release quoted south Korean media as saying: The north is led by Vice Chairman Kim Jong Un identical to NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il. The world has already recognized Kim Jong Un as the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 Compatriots in south Korea and overseas were greatly touched to witness the single-minded unity demonstrated in the DPRK in the course of such events as expression of condolences and the ceremony of bidding last farewell to the leader during the mourning period. 
					
					 Jaju Minbo of south Korea carried an article by a correspondent of Minjok Thongsin, run by compatriots in the U.S., which said:
					
					 "The scenes showing residents in the north in the ceremony of bidding last farewell to Chairman of the NDC Kim Jong Il were unprecedented in human history. Citizens put off their mufflers and padded clothes and covered roads with them so that heavy snow might not fall on them. People were sweeping roads. Others were covering roads with their mufflers and coats to keep them clean. Can there be in any other part of the world such a big family in which the leader and people trust and love each other and depend on each other? Are there in the world such people who respect and venerate their leader so much? There is nowhere in the world such country except the DPRK. There is the single-minded unity which no country can ever imagine because its leader and people respect and love each other. And because of this unity no country dares provoke the DPRK."
					
					 South Korean Internet newspaper Surprise said: The DPRK is such society in which the leader and people are single-mindedly united and it is like a wonderful big family. Its members are so simple and genuine that they think only of their leader, party and country. These unique feelings represent the real power and true picture of the DPRK. This precisely means its mightiness.
					
					 The profound mourning and the voices enthusiastically eulogizing the great man heard from among south Koreans and compatriots overseas during the mourning period spent in bitter tears helped everyone keenly realize what a great man the Korean nation held in high esteem as the sun and its father, concluded the press release.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Carries Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Carries Kim Jong Il's Work 
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday carries the full text of "Holding the Great Comrade Kim Il Sung in High Esteem Is the Noblest Moral Obligation for Our Party and People", General Secretary Kim Jong Il's talk with leading officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on Oct. 27, 1999.
					 Kim Jong Il in his work said that the history of the WPK is that of the Juche revolution started and led by President Kim Il Sung and a glorious one in which the revolutionary cause of the President has been carried forward and accomplished generation after generation.
					
					 Noting that there have been proud victories and achievements in the sacred struggle for implementing the behests of the President but a lot of work still remains to be done and a thorny path has to be covered, he stressed that the historic conditions and the environment of the times when the desire was expressed to erect his statue on his 60th birthday were not the same as those when greeting the 60th birthday of the President.
					
					 To erect his statue is contrary to his intention to carry forward the revolutionary cause of the President with communist moral obligation and the faith of the Korean people, Kim Jong Il noted, adding:
					
					 If I achieve the reunification of the country by carrying forward the revolutionary cause of the President, the people will build the statue even if no proposal is made by anyone. This would be appropriate in the light of the communist moral obligation and would make me feel honorable and proud of making revolution before the people. 
					
					 Recalling that in his lifetime the President told him to lead the party and revolution with his own ability, Kim Jong Il said as instructed by the President, he had led the WPK for the last more than three decades since he started his work at the WPK Central Committee and defended the country, revolution and socialism with Songun revolutionary leadership, keeping hold on the army when the revolution was undergoing a stern trial after the demise of the President.
					
					 In order to accomplish the revolutionary cause of the President, it is necessary to be true to the intention of the leader, successor to his cause, Kim Jong Il stressed.
					
					 Noting that he had an idea of erecting a monument to the youth well, he stressed that the young people have played an important role in every period and at every stage of the revolution.
					
					 He underscored the need to do all things including the issue of statue in line with the idea and intention of the leader with true fidelity to him.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Flays Japan's Dangerous Moves for Reinvasion
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Flays Japan's Dangerous Moves for Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Japan is persistently trying to turn itself into a military giant and realize its wild ambition for reinvasion. 
					 When the United States made public a new strategy for national defense, Japan welcomed it before anyone else and is scheming to set up within the government a "national security council" similar to the former's. 
					
					 The new defense strategy of the U.S. is for aggression against the Asia-Pacific region and its National Security Council is a notorious body for realizing its domination over the world. 
					
					 This notwithstanding, Japan shows sympathy with this strategy and seeks to establish Japan's version of the "National Security Council". That is aimed to fully gratify Japan's ambition to emerge a military giant and launch reinvasion with the help of its American master.
					
					 Japan has already done its utmost to make human and material and legal preparations to put such design into practice. 
					
					 Japan provided such legal groundwork for military action of its aggression forces as "law on overseas dispatch of troops" and "law on the situation in surrounding areas" and upgraded the Defense Agency into a ministry. 
					
					 It is also concentrating efforts on raising the striking and mobile capability of the "Self-Defense Forces". It is proven by the present "defense programme guidelines" which stresses the need to build warships and change prototype fighters. 90 percent of military hardware for SDF is home-made. 
					
					 Japan seeks to acquire the latest weapon technology through the joint development of weapons with the U.S. 
					
					 Japan has staged military exercises in military bases across Japan and its waters off them and air all the year round in an effort to bolster the cooperation capability of the SDF and the U.S. forces. 
					
					 What remains to be done by Japan at present is to establish a well regulated system capable of satisfactorily operating and using the existing material and institutional mechanisms for reinvasion. 
					
					 Japan's bid to set up "the national security council" of Japanese version is nothing but an attempt to hold military supremacy in Northeast Asia and round off a state mechanism for launching reinvasion with the U.S backing.
					
					 Japan's dangerous moves for reinvasion are being pushed forward at a final phase. 
					
					 Japan's primary target of reinvasion is the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 It is clearly evidenced by the fact that Japan allowed six civilian ports in Honshu area close to the East Sea of Korea and Kyushu area to be used as logistic and sortie bases of the U.S. navy under the simulated conditions of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 All the archipelagoes of Japan have become sortie and logistic bases for reinvasion. 
					
					 It is the plan of the Japanese militarists to put the Korean Peninsula under control and, furthermore, realize their old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere". 
					
					 But, this is no more than a daydream. 
					
					 The world is watching with vigilance the black-hearted intention of Japan to emerge a leader of Asia, backed by the U.S., and the service personnel and people of the DPRK are highly alerted. 
					
					 If Japan persists in its moves to become a military giant and launch reinvasion, far from drawing a lesson from the blood-stained past history, it will face only a disgraceful defeat and self-destruction.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Untrustworthy Government of Japan
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Untrustworthy Government of Japan
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Both ruling and opposition parties and people of Japan are becoming increasingly critical of the Noda government's perfidious behavior over the issue of consumption tax. 
					 It decided to increase the consumption tax step by step, reneging on its election commitment made late last year that "it would not raise the consumption tax in four years." It is now contemplating codifying it by law this year. 
					
					 Infuriated by this, leaders of opposition parties issued statements one after another condemning the government for reneging on its promise made with the people. 
					
					 Some forces of the ruling Democratic Party came out to sympathize with the moves of the opposition party side and rejected a series of reform policies which the prime minister considers as important including the consumption tax increase. They formed a new party after deserting the ruling party in protest against them, throwing it into mayhem. 
					
					 Against the background of this confused political landscape there was a cabinet reshuffle in less than four months after its emergence.
					
					 Noda dismissed those who had been considered by ruling and opposition parties as trouble makers and appointed the man related to the opposition party as deputy prime minister. This is aimed to strengthen the function of the official residence of the prime minister and achieve compromise with opposition forces in a bid to carry out reform policies.
					
					 Under this situation the Liberal Democratic Party insisted it would not agree with an agreement on the consumption tax increase.
					
					 This led to intensified offensive and defensive warfare between the ruling and opposition parties and the widened division within the ruling camp and touched off growing discontent of the people. It is said there is likelihood that in case of failure to deliberate on the bill at the Diet on Jan. 24, this may lead to the dissolution of the House of Representatives and the general election.
					
					 Kozo Watanabe, top advisor to the Democratic Party, deplorably said that it is the first time that the politics is in such chaos.
					
					 According to results of the nationwide opinion poll released by Tokyo Shimbun, 85 percent of the respondents expressed discontent with the politics.
					
					 The politics in Japan is 15 per cent one, indeed. 
					
					 Such poor shape of politics in Japan is deserved judgment and inescapable fate of the politicians of Japan who prolong their remaining days with scramble for power, forsaken by the people, as they are bereft of even elementary morality.
					
					 It is quite natural for Japan to be derided by the international community as an untrustworthy government and political pigmy.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind Massacres of Civilians Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind Massacres of Civilians Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The society of bereaved families of civilians killed before and after the Korean War and members of opposition parties of south Korea held a joint memorial service in South Kyongsang Province on Jan. 13 demanding the south Korean authorities opt for probing the truth behind the massacres of civilians.
					 Speakers at the memorial service recalled that police mercilessly killed more than 100 innocent civilians in Sokgye-ri of Ryonghyon-Myon, Hail-Myon of Kosong County and other areas in July 1950. 
					
					 At that time a lot of civilians were grievously killed by U.S. troops in Konmyong, Jongdong, Sopho and Ryonghyon myons, they said, adding: American warplanes flew to villages to indiscriminately bomb and strafe them.
					
					 Nevertheless, the present "government" let the south Korean Committee for Settling the Past History for Truth and Reconciliation make a decision that it was impossible to probe the truth behind massacres of civilians by police and the U.S. forces.
					
					 They stressed that they could no longer overlook such behavior little short of dropping bombs over the heads of bereaved families again.
					
					 They urged the "government" to probe the truth behind the massacres and reinstate the victims and their bereaved families as early as possible.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Martyr Held in Seoul
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Martyr Held in Seoul 
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A memorial service was held in Seoul for martyr Pak Jong Chol on Jan. 14, 25 years after he was killed in cold blood by the fascist hangmen.
					 Attending it were the chairman of the society for commemorating the death anniversary of Pak, his father and the chief of the Unification Study Center.
					
					 The speakers at the service recalled that Pak, a student of Seoul National University, was killed by the brutal torture of the police in the days of the past military dictatorial "government".
					
					 They deplored that since the appearance of the Lee Myung Bak "government" the social democracy has been thrown into a serious crisis. 
					
					 Recalling that the martyr always hoped to see a society where the popular masses are its master, they declared they would struggle for genuine democracy.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest against Conclusion of FTA
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest against Conclusion of FTA
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A rally was held in Seoul on Jan. 14 protesting against the moves to conclude U.S.-south Korea "Free Trade Agreement" (FTA).
					 Attending the rally were members of the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement and other civic and social bodies and figures of opposition parties and people from all walks of life.
					
					 The speakers at the rally said that FTA is an unequal and humiliating agreement as it leaves the sovereignty of south Korean economy to the tender mercy of the U.S. 
					
					 The additional massive import of American beef is seriously threatening the vital rights of the stock breeders, they deplored, warning they would judge the Lee Myung Bak "government" and politicians in the forthcoming "National Assembly" (NA) election for ramming the motion calling for the ratification of the humiliating FTA through the NA for the sake of the privileged circle who accounts just for less than one percent of the population.
					
					 They declared they would intensify the anti-"government" struggle in the future.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Supported by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Supported by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Yanbian Regional Association under the General Association of Koreans in China and its branches and the Yanbian Regional Youth Committee under the Federation of Korean Youths in China held a meeting in Yanji, Jilin Province on Jan. 15 in support of the joint New Year editorial published in the homeland.
					 At the meeting, speakers said that the people in the motherland are accelerating a grand drive for achieving prosperity in the new century of the Juche era, led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The slogan "Let all the compatriots open the gates of national reunification full of fresh confidence!" reflects the aspiration of all the Koreans and the demand of the era and the general orientation and militant goal of the reunification movement, they said, and went on:
					
					 We will glorify the feats Kim Jong Il performed in the efforts to achieve the country's reunification in this significant year, the fifth anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 The desire of the Koreans for the country's reunification is sure to come true as there is the great programme for the country's reunification provided by him and they are led by Kim Jong Un, the lodestar of the country's reunification, they noted.
					
					 They called upon the Koreans in China to stage a dynamic movement for the country's reunification to make a breakthrough towards independent reunification this year.

articles.title: Senior Official of Korean Organization in China Eulogizes Immortal Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Senior Official of Korean Organization in China Eulogizes Immortal Exploits of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, on Jan. 13 made public a statement titled "Let us uphold the brilliant Songun commander of Mt. Paektu forever and glorify his exploits performed for national reunification". 
					 The special report of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea reflects the unanimous ardent desire of all the fellow countrymen to hold General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages as eternal father of the nation and glorify his revolutionary life and undying revolutionary exploits forever, it said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il led all Koreans along the way of independence and great national unity and ushered in the June 15 era of reunification in which the nation is advancing in the spirit of "By our nation itself". 
					
					 He put the dignity of the country and the nation and national power on the highest level and devoted himself to accomplishing the cause of national reunification. His noble life and immortal exploits will shine for all ages. 
					
					  The General Association of Koreans in China and all other Koreans in China will turn out as one in the patriotic drive for making a breakthrough towards national reunification this year under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un with the firm faith that Kim Jong Il will always be with us.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Commemorated in Italy
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Commemorated in Italy
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee to commemorate the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, was inaugurated with due ceremony in Italy on Jan. 13.
					 The general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy and the president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Birth Anniversaries of Great Men to Be Commemorated in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Birth Anniversaries of Great Men to Be Commemorated in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A joint annual meeting of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association took place in Kinshasa on Jan. 10.
					 The meeting reviewed last year's activities of the two organizations and dealt with the matters to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the 70th anniversary of birth of General Secretary Kim Jong Il with splendor.
					
					 It discussed their action program for this year to further activate the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and strengthen solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 Present there were Chairman of the Committee Kamwiziku Octave, Chairman of the Association Otete Gaston Mboyo and other personages and members of organizations for the study of the Juche idea and friendship and solidarity.

articles.title: Indonesian Party Leader on Development of Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Indonesian Party Leader on Development of Relations with WPK
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Megawati Soekarnoputri, general chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, met DPRK Ambassador to Indonesia Ri Jong Ryul on Jan. 11.
					 The untimely demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il is a bitter grief to myself and the Soekarno family, she said, adding:
					
					 I cherish as eternal memoirs the benevolence he meticulously showed for me with fraternal affection whenever I visited the DPRK.
					
					 The future of the DPRK is certain as it is guided by the dear respected Kim Jong Un fully carrying forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Through the joint New Year editorial we came to know well about the stand of the Workers' Party of Korea to glorify this year marking the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as a year of proud victory, a year when an era of prosperity is unfolding, under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We expect that the WPK and people would achieve fresh successes in attaining the goals set for this year, and support the stand of the DPRK to open the gate to national reunification by achieving national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 We wish the Korean party and people success in their courageous efforts to build a thriving nation and realize national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will strive for the development of the cooperative relations between the two parties.

articles.title: Polish on Koreans' Deep Reverence for Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Polish on Koreans' Deep Reverence for Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Polish Internet homepage "DPRK" on Jan. 13 posted a TV program titled "Scene of harmonious whole in December in tears of blood".
					 It said:
					
					 The heaviest snowfall in decades fell in Pyongyang at the time when General Secretary Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden.
					
					 Citizens took off their clothes and covered with them those wreaths, white bouquets and flowers laid at the portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il to keep them from snow.
					
					 Also on the day when the ceremony for bidding last farewell to the leader was solemnly held, Pyongyangites vied with each other to take off their padded clothes and mufflers and spread them on the roads, along which the hearse would pass, despite the cold weather.
					
					 The reverence of the people for him is so profound.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un took benevolent steps to protect the health of the people mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il in the cold weather and heavy snowfall.
					
					 We carry the program recording such scenes unprecedented in the Korean history.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Russia and UK issued statements on Jan. 10 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					 The Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea said in a statement:
					
					 The joint New Year editorial published by major newspapers of the DPRK stressed that marking the fifth anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration, the action program of the June 15 joint declaration, the atmosphere of supporting the north-south declarations and the will to implement them should prevail across the whole of the national territory.
					
					 Convinced that the whole nation in the north and the south of Korea and abroad will get firmly united under the banners of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and make a breakthrough for independent reunification this year, we express full support and solidarity with the Korean people's cause of national reunification. 
					
					 The Stoke-on-Trent Branch of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said in a statement:
					
					 The Korean people will implement the militant tasks set forth in the joint editorial and thus brilliantly adorn this year marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The heroic and revolutionary people of Kim Il Sung's Korea will surely open the gate to prosperity.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche will be reliably inherited thanks to Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: British Organizations Hit S. Korean Authorities for Obstruction to Mourners' Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
British Organizations Hit S. Korean Authorities for Obstruction to Mourners' Visit to DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a joint statement on Jan. 7 in protest against the south Korean authorities' fascist suppression of members of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon).
					 The statement said:
					
					 We were stunned by the south Korean authorities' crackdown on the chairman and core members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					
					 What is noticeable in particular is that they were tried only for their attempt to visit the DPRK to mourn the so untimely passing away of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. It is inconceivable to bar any people from visiting to express condolences and try them. 
					
					 Many pro-reunification patriots have been arrested and kept behind bars in south Korea, the statement said, urging the south Korean authorities to release those members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon at once.

articles.title: Russian FM Condemns U.S. Violation of International Laws
articles.content:
Russian FM Condemns U.S. Violation of International Laws
 Moscow, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry recently made public on its website data showing the U.S. violation of international laws.
					 According to the data, the U.S. had detained more than 770 persons, who were denied status of POWs, in special prison in Guantanamo base for the last 10 years and 600 of them served long prison terms without judgment of guilty.
					
					 The same thing happened in Afghanistan, too, the data said, adding that the reality proves that the U.S. has been wantonly violating the international laws.

articles.title: Iranian President Not to Yield to U.S. Pressure
articles.content:
Iranian President Not to Yield to U.S. Pressure
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad clarified the Iranian government's stand not to yield to the pressure of the U.S. in a press conference during his recent visit to Ecuador.
					 He disclosed that the U.S. was resorting to any moves to block the advance of the Iranian people and said that if the U.S. attacks Iran, the army and people of his country would strongly react to the enemies' aggression.
					
					 He stressed that the U.S. blockade and sanctions would have no effect on the development of Iran.

articles.title: "United Russia" Party Rejects OSCE Conclusion
articles.content:
"United Russia" Party Rejects OSCE Conclusion
 Moscow, January 17 (KCNA) -- The "United Russia" Party dismissed the conclusion of the watchers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) that ample conditions were not provided in the period of the recent elections of the State Duma in the country.
					 The first vice secretary of the Standing Committee of the Supreme Council of the party said that such conclusion is not appropriate to the duty of those who are to watch the observation of the election procedures.
					
					 He noted that the social interest in the election and the zeal were very high.

articles.title: Chavez: Venezuela to Close Consulate in Miami
articles.content:
Chavez: Venezuela to Close Consulate in Miami
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez said Friday that his government will close its consulate in Miami after the U.S. government expelled a diplomat.
					 Chavez said he decided the consulate will shut its doors in response to what he called an unfair action by the U.S. State Department.
					
					 "We're going to close it. It's OK. There won't be a consulate in Miami," Chavez said during his annual speech to the National Assembly.
					
					 Livia Acosta Noguera, Venezuela's consul general in Miami, was ordered out of the U.S. last weekend following an FBI investigation into allegations that she discussed a possible cyber-attack on the U.S. government while she was assigned to the Venezuelan Embassy in Mexico.

articles.title: Mozambican President on Successes in 2011
articles.content:
Mozambican President on Successes in 2011
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- President Armando Guebuza has called on all Mozambicans to observe measures of austerity in 2012 and to commit themselves to increased productivity and to fighting against obstacles to the country's development.
					 President Guebuza said 2011 had been marked by a strengthening of national unity, self-esteem and patriotism. Peace and the feeling of solidarity among Mozambicans had been consolidated, and the rule of law and multi-party democracy deepened.
					
					 "In the context of the struggle against material poverty, we built new social and economic infrastructures which are contributing to improving the quality of life of our people", he said.

articles.title: Singapore Reacts to U.S. Sanctions
articles.content:
Singapore Reacts to U.S. Sanctions
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Singapore's Foreign Ministry said in a statement on Friday in response to U.S. government sanctions on a Singapore-based firm for its alleged dealings with Iran that the sanctions are a "domestic" and "unilateral" act, and that Singapore should not be expected to enforce the laws of other countries.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun difunde obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun difunde obra de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ACNC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun inserto en su edicion de hoy una charla del Dirigente Kim Jong Il con los funcionarios directivos del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea realizada el 27 de octubre de 1999 "Enaltecer al gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung es el mas sublime deber moral de nuestro partido y pueblo".
					En su obra el Dirigente subrayo que la historia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea es la de la revolucion del Juche allanada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y la gloriosa que se lleva adelante de generacion en generacion la causa revolucionaria del Presidente.
					
					Refirio que en la sagrada lucha por materializar el legado del Presidente, hemos alcanzado gloriosas victorias y exitos, pero nos quedan aun muchos trabajos y debemos atravesar el arduo camino y agrego que la propuesta de construir su estatua de bronce con motivo del 60o aniversario de su natalicio no era igual que el tiempo del 60o de natalicio del Presidente al juzgar tanto la condicion historica como la situacion de la epoca.
					
					Dijo que erguir su estatua de bronce no conviene a su voluntad de heredar y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Presidente con la obligacion moral comunista ni a la conviccion guardada en el alma del pueblo coreano.
					
					Acentuo que si reunifica la patria continuando la causa revolucionaria del Lider, el pueblo construira la estatua de bronce, lo que es una obligacion moral comunista y actitud digna ante el pueblo y la revolucion.
					
					Recordo que en su vida el Presidente instruyo al Dirigente que debia orientar el partido y la revolucion con su capacidad y agrego que desde cuando inicio su trabajo, segun la instruccion del Presidente, en el Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea,  ha venido dirigiendo durante mas de 30 anos el PTC y cuando fallecio el Presidente  y la revolucion sufria las vicisitudes dificiles  defendio la patria, apoyandose en el ejercito, la revolucion y el socialismo con la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					
					Enfatizo que a fin de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Presidente, todos deben seguir el proposito del continuador de la causa.
					
					Expuso que el mismo pensaba en levantar el monumento de elogio a los jovenes, quienes jugaron un importante rol en cada periodo y etapa de la revolucion.
					
					Se refirio a que deben realizar todos los trabajos inclusive el tema de erguir la estatua de bronce conforme a la idea y la voluntad del Dirigente con la sincera fidelidad a el.

articles.title: Aprobada la ley de educacion superior
articles.content:
Aprobada la ley de educacion superior
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ACNC) -- Fue aprobada la ley de la educacion superior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Segun el decreto fechado 14 de diciembre del 100 (2011) de la Era Juche del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, la ley consta de 7 capitulos y 68 articulos. 
					
					La ley contribuira a desarrollar la educacion superior mediante el establecimiento estricto de orden y disciplina en la organizacion y gestion, la educacion y la investigacion cientifica de los organismos de educacion superior y a formar mas a los cientificos, tecnicos y especialistas listos en lo ideo-politico y dotados de ricos conocimientos cientifico-tecnicos y de capacidad creativa.

articles.title: Editado tomo 100 de Obras Completas de Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Editado tomo 100 de Obras Completas de Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ACNC) -- La Editora del Partido del Trabajo de Corea dio a luz el ultimo tomo 100 de las "Obras Completas de Kim Il Sung", ciclo de la inmortal idea Juche que compila sistematica y globalmente por orden cronologico los trabajados del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					    Este libro redacta el tomo 6 de las memorias del Presidente Kim Il Sung "En el Transcurso del Siglo".
					
					  Muestra las hazanas, las experiencias de lucha y la noble personalidad de gran hombre realizadas por el Presidente quien desde marzo hasta noviembre de 1937 aumento y fortalecio el Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea como fuerzas revolucionarias del Juche y preparo la unidad de las filas revolucionarias y la base masiva de la lucha armada.
					
					  El capitulo XVI "Cruzando y recruzando el rio Amrok" registra el contenido de que el Presidente realizo la expedicion a Fusong para avanzar hacia el interior del pais y fortalecio en todos los lugares del pais las organizaciones de la Asociacion para la Restauracion de la Patria.
					
					  Ademas, narra el espiritu inconmovible de defender a riesgo de su vida al Lider de los escoltas de la Comandancia y la lucha de los combatientes revolucionarios antijaponeses que cumplieron hasta el fin el deber revolucionario dado por el Presidente.
					
					  El capitulo XVII "Corea esta viva" registra el contenido de que el Presidente recordo que organizo y dirigio victoriosamente la batalla de Pochonbo al avanzar hacia el interior del pais con el grueso del Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea.
					
					  Redacta el hecho de que el Presidente organizo el Cuerpo Infantil y cuido a los miembros de este cuerpo.
					
					  El capitulo XVIII "En medio de las llamaradas de la guerra China-Japon" se refiere al contenido de que el Presidente organizo y dirigio dinamicamente la lucha por la preparacion de la resistencia pannacional frente a la nueva situacion.

articles.title: ACNC critica la campana japonesa para reagresion
articles.content:
ACNC critica la campana japonesa para reagresion 
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ACNC) -- Japon recurre obstinadamente a realizar la potencia militar y la ambicion de nueva agresion.
					Tan pronto como fue publicada la nueva estrategia de defensa nacional de Estados Unidos, Japon la aplaudio mas que nadie e intenta establecer nuevamente en el gobierno el "Consejo de Seguridad Nacional" como el norteamericano.
					
					La nueva estrategia de defensa nacional de EE.UU. es la agresiva que apunta a la region de Asia-Pacifico y el Consejo de Seguridad de EE.UU. es el infame aparato que asegura la heguemonia del mundo.
					
					El pais isleno intenta adherirse a la estrategia agresiva de EE.UU. y fundar el "Consejo de Seguridad Nacional" de version japonesa, a fin de realizar a toda costa la potencia militar y la ambicion de reagresion bajo el abrigo del imperio.
					
					En el pasado, Japon vino esforzandose para este fin por los preparativos humanos, materiales y legales.
					
					Preparo los esquemas legales que garantizan las acciones militares de sus fuerzas agresivas como la "ley de envio de los efectivos japoneses a ultramar" y la "ley sobre la situacion de region contorna" y elevo la categoria de la agencia de defensa al ministerio de defensa.
					
					Da prioridad a elevar la capacidad de golpe y movilidad de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" y subrayo en el "programa de plan de defensa" la construccion de buques de guerra y el cambio de cazas principales. Japon produce en su pais 90% de los equipos de armamentos de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					Ademas, trata de poseer la tecnologia de las armas de punta a traves del desarrollo conjunto de armas con EE.UU.
					
					En las bases militares en distintas localidades, aguas y aereas de sus contornos, Japon libra abiertamente todo el ano los ejercicios militares de de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" para elevar la capacidad cooperativa con las tropas norteamericanas.
					
					Ahora, le queda a este pais establecer el ordenado sistema de organo capaz de controlar y usar los aparatos materiales e institucionales preparados hasta ahora para la nueva agresion.
					
					Las autoridades japonesas intentan fundar el "Consejo de Seguridad Nacional" de version japonesa para tomar la heguemonia militar en la region del Nordeste Asiatico bajo el amparo del imperio y establecer el sistema de organo estatal por la reagresion.
					
					Las maquinaciones para la reagresion de Japon se promueven muy peligrosamente en la etapa final y su primer blanco es la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Japon permitio a EE.UU. usar como base de despegue y logistica de las fuerzas navales norteamericanas 6 puertos civiles en las zonas de Honshu hacia el Mar Este de Corea y en Kyushu bajo el pretexto del supuesto "tiempo de emergencia" de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Todo el territorio japones se ha convertido en la base de despegue y logistica para la reagresion.
					
					Los militaristas japoneses intentan ocupar la Peninsula Coreana y, a la larga, realizar el antiguo sueno de la "Esfera de Coprosperidad de la Gran Asia Oriental".
					
					Pero, esto no pasa de ser una ilusion irrealizable.
					
					El mundo observa con vigilancia el intento negro de este pais isleno de convertirse en el caudillo de Asia bajo el abrigo del imperio, y el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea estan en el estado de alerta.
					
					Si Japon se aferra por fin a las maniobras para realizar la potencia militar y la nueva agresion en lugar de sacar merecidas lecciones en la sangrienta historia del pasado, le caeran solo la vergonzosa derrota y la muerte.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la politica de Japon
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la politica de Japon
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ACNC) -- En estos dias, se alzan en Japon las voces de desconfianza y censura del partido gobernante, partidos opositores y los habitantes ante el proceder traidor del gobierno de Noda respecto al impuesto de gastos.
					El gobierno de Noda decidio aumentar por etapas el impuesto de gastos a contrapelo de la promesa de elecciones hecha a finales del ano pasado de que "no elevaria durante 4 anos el impuesto de gastos" y este ano intenta fijarlo como una ley.
					
					Los lideres de partidos opositores en sus declaraciones criticaron unanimemente calificandolo de una traicion a la promesa con los habitantes. Algunas fuerzas del Partido Democratico en el poder rechazan la politica de unas reformas del premier japones como el aumento del impuesto de gastos simpatizando con el movimiento de los partidos opositores y renunciaron al partido en senal de protesta y establecieron el nuevo partido causando disturbios en el seno del partido.
					
					En tal complicada situacion politica se efectuo la reestructuracion del gabinete al cabo de 4 meses de su fundacion.
					
					El premier japones Noda depuso a los miembros problematicos del partido en el poder y los partidos opositores y puso a uno relacionado con los partidos opositores en el cargo del interino no.1 del premier, con el fin de realizar la politica de reformas fortaleciendo la funcion de la residencia del premier y logrando la conciliacion con las fuerzas de los partidos opositores.
					
					Pero, el Partido Liberal de Japon insistio en que no participaria en el debate sobre el incremento de impuesto de gastos.
					
					En medio de los conflictos entre el partido en el poder y los partidos opositores, la agravacion de division en el primero y la elevacion de desconfianza de los habitantes, se reportan que si no se somete el proyecto de ley a la consideracion de la Dieta que tendra lugar el dia 24, habria la posibilidad de disolver la camara de representantes y efectuar las elecciones generales.
					
					El asesor supremo del Partido Democratico Kozo Watanabe, dijo que es por primera vez la circunstancia desordenada de la politica como ahora y expreso su sentimiento de querer llorar.
					
					Segun la encuesta de la opinion publica nacional publicada por Tokio Shimbun, el 85% de los contestadores expresaron sus quejas a la politica.
					
					O sea, la politica de Japon es la de 15%.
					
					Tal situacion politica de Japon es la sentencia merecida e inevitable destino para los politicos japoneses carentes de moralidad que se disputan la heguemonia dando espaldas a la opinion publica.
					
					Es natural que Japon es censurado y burlado por parte de la sociedad internacional como gobierno indigno de confianza y como enano politico.
